{"step_by_step_thinking": "Vitamin K is known to be a cofactor for the synthesis of several coagulation factors. According to Document [0], Vitamin K is an essential factor to a hepatic gamma-glutamyl carboxylase that adds a carboxyl group to glutamic acid residues on factors II, VII, IX and X. Therefore, Factor II is a Vitamin K dependent factor.", "answer_choice": "A"}
